gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਅਰਥ ਟੀਡੀ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ ॥ ਚਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਚਾਰ ਚੀਟੀ ਸਮਾਨ ॥੪੮੭॥
transliteration: Aagaddan Arth Teedipramaan|| Chaagaddan Chaar Cheetisamaan||487||
translation: The army looked like locusts and array of ants.487.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਹੁੜੇ ਨੇਖ ॥ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁੰਧ ਅਤਕਾੲਿ ਦੇਖ ॥
transliteration: Baagaddan Beer Baahude Nekh|| Jaagaddan Juddh Atkaae Dekh||
translation: The warriors reached near Atkaaye in order to see him fighting.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਦੇਵ ਜੈ ਜੈ ਕਹੰਤ ॥ ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੂਪ ਧਨ ਧਨ ਭਨੰਤ ॥੪੮੮॥
transliteration: Daagaddan Dev Jai Jai Kahant|| Bhaagaddan Bhoop Dhan Dhan Bhanant||488||
translation: The gods hailed him and the king uttered “Bravo, Bravo !”.488.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕਹਕ ਕਾਲੀ ਕਰਾਲ ॥ ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੂਹ ਜੁੱਗਣ ਬਿਸਾਲ ॥
transliteration: Kaagaddan Kahak Kaalikaraal|| Jaagaddan Jooh Judgad Bidaal||
translation: The terrible goddess Kali began to shout and great number of Yoginis roamed in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੂਤ ਭੈਰੋ ਅਨੰਤ ॥ ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਪਾਣੰ ਕਰੰਤ ॥੪੮੯॥
transliteration: Bhaagaddan Bhoot Bhairo Anant|| Saagaddan Sron Paanan Karant||489||
translation: Innumerable Bhairvas and ghosts began to drink blood.489.

gurmukhi: ਡਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਡੳੁਰ ਡਾਰਣ ਡਹੱਕ ॥ ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਕਾਕੰ ਕਹੱਕ ॥
transliteration: Daagaddan Daur Daakan Dahakk|| Kaagaddan Kroor Kaakan Kahakk||
translation: The tabors of vampires sounded and the inauspicious crows began to caw;

gurmukhi: ਚਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਚਤ੍ਰ ਚਾਵਡੀ ਚਿਕਾਰ ॥ ਭਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਭੂਤ ਡਾਰਤ ਧਮਾਰ ॥੪੯੦॥
transliteration: Chaagaddan Chatra Chaavadichiknr|| Bhaagaddan Bhoot Daarat Dhamaar||490||
translation: On all the four sides there were heard and seen shrieks of vultures and leapings and hopping of ghosts and fiends.490.

gurmukhi: ਟੁਟੇ ਪਰੇ ॥ ਨਵੇ ਮੁਰੇ ॥ ਅਸੰ ਧਰੇ ॥ ਰਿਸੰ ਭਰੇ ॥੪੯੧॥
transliteration: Toute Dare|| Nave Mure|| Asan Ddare|| Risan Bhare||491||
translation: The warriors felt weakness and then regained strength and in rage caught hold of their swords.491.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੰ ਸਰੰ ॥ ਰਿਸੰ ਭਰੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੈ ਦਿਸੰ ॥ ਚਪੇ ਕਿਸੰ ॥੪੯੨॥
transliteration: Chhoutan Saran|| Chakiyo Haran|| Roukidisan|| Chape Kisan||492||
translation: Seeing the discharge of arrows the clouds wondered; because of the arrows all the sides were hindered.492.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੰ ਸਰੰ ॥ ਰਿਸੰ ਭਰੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੈ ਭਟੰ ॥ ਜਿਮੰ ਅਟੰ ॥੪੯੩॥
transliteration: Chhoutan Saran|| Risan Bharan|| Girai Bhatan|| Jiman Atan||493||
translation: The arrows are being discharged in fury and the warriors are falling on the earth like the earth like the effacement of the through ones.493.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਮੇ ਘਯੰ ॥ ਭਰੇ ਭਯੰ ॥ ਚਪੇ ਚਲੇ ॥ ਭਟੰ ਭਲੇ ॥੪੯੪॥
transliteration: Ghoume Ghayan|| Bhare Bhayan|| Chape Chale|| Bhatan Bhale||494||
translation: The frightened warriors, while wandering, are being wounded and great heroes are flying fast.494.

gurmukhi: ਰਟੈਂ ਹਰੰ ॥ ਰਿਸੰ ਜਰੰ ॥ ਰੁਪੈ ਰਣੰ ॥ ਘੁਮੇ ਬ੍ਰਣੰ ॥੪੯੫॥
transliteration: Ratain Haran|| Risan Jaran|| Roupai Ranan|| Ghoume Branan||495||
translation: They are reciting the name of Shiva in order to kill the enemies with jealousy in their mind and they are tighting in the field wandering with fear.495.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੈਂ ਧਰੰ ॥ ਹੁਲੈਂ ਨਰੰ ॥ ਸਰੰ ਤਛੇ ॥ ਕਛੰ ਕਛੇ ॥੪੯੬॥
transliteration: Girain Dharan|| Hulain Naran|| Saran Tachhe|| Kachhan Kachhe||496||
translation: The people are getting delighted with the falling of demons on the earth; the arrows are penetrating into the demons and the warriors are being crushed.496.
